Deprecated API

Contents
  • Deprecated Classes
  • Deprecated Fields
Deprecated Classes
org.kiji.examples.phonebook.AddressFieldExtractor
          using "Raw" MapReduce over Kiji tables is no longer the preferred mechanism for iterating over rows of a Kiji table. To write a function that processes and updates a table in a row-by-row fashion, you should extend org.kiji.mapreduce.produce.KijiProducer. You should use org.kiji.mapreduce.produce.KijiProduceJobBuilder for constructing such MapReduce jobs. 
org.kiji.examples.phonebook.DeleteEntriesByState
          using "Raw" MapReduce is no longer the preferred mechanism to iterate over rows of a Kiji table. You should instead use the KijiMR library. To write a function that processes and updates a table in a row-by-row fashion, you should extend org.kiji.mapreduce.produce.KijiProducer. You should use org.kiji.mapreduce.produce.KijiProduceJobBuilder for constructing such MapReduce jobs. You will still need to explicitly open a KijiTableWriter to call KijiDeleter.deleteRow(org.kiji.schema.EntityId). 
org.kiji.examples.phonebook.IncrementTalkTime
          using "Raw" MapReduce jobs that interact with Kiji tables is no longer the preferred mechanism. The org.kiji.schema.mapreduce classes are deprecated and may be removed in a future version of KijiSchema. You should instead use the KijiMR library, extend the KijiMapper class and use the KijiMapReduceJobBuilder class to configure such jobs, rather than use classes like DistributedCacheJars and KijiConfKeys.
